summary:
The Security Council,

Adopted Resolution 1953 (2010) on 14 December 2010,

Welcoming the reports of the Secretary-General on UN operation in Cyprus and his mission of good offices,

Noting the necessity to keep UNFICYP beyond 15 December 2010,

Reaffirming the primary role of the UN in assisting the parties to a comprehensive and durable settlement,

Echoing the Secretary-General that the responsibility for finding a solution lies with the Cypriots,

Welcoming progress in negotiations and leaders' joint statements,

Expressing concern at the slow pace of progress, stressing the status quo is unsustainable,

Urging leaders to increase momentum in negotiations for an enduring, comprehensive and just settlement,

Emphasizing the importance of all parties engaging fully, flexibly and constructively,

Welcoming efforts to stimulate progress and intention to meet with leaders in January 2011,

Welcoming implementation of some confidence-building measures, and calling for a renewed effort,

Reaffirming the importance of continued crossings of the Green Line,

Convinced of the benefits of a comprehensive and durable Cyprus settlement,

Urging the two sides and their leaders to foster positive public rhetoric,

Highlighting the supportive role the international community will continue to play,

Taking note of the assessment of the Secretary-General on the security situation,

Recalling the Secretary-General's firm belief on the 1989 aide memoire,

Welcoming progress in demining activities and activities of the Committee on Missing Persons,

Agreeing on the essential participation of civil society groups,

Stressing the need for a rigorous, strategic approach to peacekeeping deployments,

Welcoming the intention of the Secretary-General to keep all peacekeeping operations under close review.
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

* Welcomes progress in negotiations between parties in Cyprus and efforts of Special Advisor Alexander Downer and Special Representative Lisa Buttenheim.
* Expresses gratitude to Cyprus and Greece for funding UNFICYP and requests further contributions.
* Welcomes efforts to prevent HIV/AIDS and other communicable diseases in peacekeeping operations.
